title: Protected sign-up viewer page requiring authentication

requirements.summary: Create a protected '/signups' page that displays all Blue Panthers sign-ups, requiring Internet Identity authentication before showing the list
acceptanceCriteria: A new route (e.g., '/signups') is registered in App.tsx and accessible via navigation.
Unauthenticated users see a sign-in prompt instead of the sign-up list.
Authenticated users see a table of all Blue Panthers sign-up entries fetched from the backend.
The page includes login and logout controls consistent with the rest of the app's design.
The page is reachable via a navigation link in the app header or menu.

file_operations.description: Create a new protected page component that displays all player sign-ups in a styled table. The page must check authentication status using useInternetIdentity and show a sign-in prompt with login button when the user is not authenticated. For authenticated users, fetch and display all sign-ups using the getAllSignUps query from useQueries, showing player details (name, email, phone, age, position, experience level) in a table format consistent with AdminPage and OwnerDashboard styling. Include login/logout controls in the page header. Use the authorization component's authentication patterns to ensure proper access control.

Register a new route '/signups' in the router configuration that renders the SignUpsPage component within the Layout wrapper, positioned between the existing '/' route and '/owner' route to maintain a logical navigation flow.

Add a navigation link labeled 'Sign-Ups' in the header navigation that points to '/signups', positioned between the home link and the existing conditional 'Admin' link. The new link should be visible to all users (authenticated and unauthenticated) and styled consistently with existing navigation items.
